page.title: 06Education
page.content: There is a playgroup in Barrowby which is held in the Memorial Hall. Barrowby also has a primary school in Church Street. The school has 204 children on roll and there are seventeen people employed. There are eight teachers, one caretaker, one secretary and seven dinner ladies. There are seven classes in the school and the children are aged between five and eleven. The Parents' Association organises many fund raising activities to buy extra equipment for the school. There are no school dinners so the children bring a packed lunch. The school holds evening classes including:- art, keep fit, yoga, dressmaking and German. Evening classes are held on Mondays and Thursdays. There is no school in Sedgebrook. It was closed in 1984.
